attributes.action: Hold an immediate referendum on calling a General Election
attributes.additional_details: A general election cannot be called based on a petition of 1,000,000 votes, but a referendum can be called to give the entire country a chance to have their say. To deny the British people a choice would be undemocratic, and the people would be held hostage by their own government.
attributes.background: Hold a referendum as soon as possible on whether to call a General Election.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Introduce a mid-term referendum on whether to hold an early General Election
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734396
